newsitem.title: SWEDEN: FORECAST - Trelleborg 9 mo profit seen 891 mln SKR.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Trelleborg 9 mo profit seen 891 mln SKR.

text.p: Swedish mining group Trelleborg was expected to post a profit after financial items of 891 million crown for the first nine months of 1996, a Reuters poll of eight analysts found on Monday.

In the same period a year ago Trelleborg reported a profit of 3.17 billion crown but this result included a capital gain on the sale of shares in Falconbridge and Munksjo as well as interests in the profit from both these companies.
For full year 1996 analysts expected Trelleborg to report a profit of 1.18 billion crowns.
The company's profit for the full year 1995 was 3.51 billion crowns, corrected for restructuring costs of 1.55 billion crowns.
Next year's profit was forecast at 1.30 billion crowns.
The forecasts came in at an interval between 1.01 billion crowns and 1.58 billion crowns.
For 1998 the average forecast from six analysts was for a profit after financial items of 1.48 billion crowns.
The forecast ranged from 1.37-1.60 billion crowns.
The analysts polled by Reuters said they had downwardly adjusted their forecasts due moves in metal prices.
"Copper prices have been a cause for concern," one analyst said. "The levels are very low now and I don't think there will be any big improvement in price levels during the coming year."
Trelleborg's nine-month report is due to be released on October 25.
